luascript.code:
--local watch = gui:getComponentByName('WATCH')
--local sys_time = sys:getTime()

local time = gui:getComponentByName('TIME')
local t = sys:getTime()
print("year : "..tostring(t.year))
print(t["year"])
print(t["month"])
print(t["day"])
print(t["hour"])
print(t["minute"])
print(t["second"])

--time:setUIData(sys_time.year, sys_time.month, sys_time.day, false)
time:setUITime(t.hour, t.minute, t.second, false)

--print('watch onload\n')
function watch_timer_call_back()
	local watch = gui:getComponentByName('WATCH')
	local time = gui:getComponentByName('TIME')
	local sys_time = sys:getTime()
	watch:setWatchTime(sys_time.hour, sys_time.minute, sys_time.second)
	--time:setUIData(sys_time.year, sys_time.month, sys_time.day)
	time:setUITime(sys_time.hour, sys_time.minute, sys_time.second)
	--gui:checkMemState()
	--print(collectgarbage("count"))
end

watch_timer = sys:createTimer(watch_timer_call_back, 500)
watch_timer:run()

local watch = gui:getComponentByName('WATCH')
local sys_time = sys:getTime() --watch:getSystemTime()
watch:setWatchTime(sys_time.hour, sys_time.minute, sys_time.second, false)

print('watch unload\n')
if watch_timer then
	watch_timer:stop()
	sys:deleteTimer(watch_timer)
	watch_timer = nil
end

print("watch touch up")
